About Me

Fun facts time!

Bio

As a Nashville-based IT Professional of over 18+ years experience, I have had roles ranging from Front End Developer cranking out custom pages for a major entertainment company to being a Sr. Systems Analyst, managing massive Enterprise environments, consistently enabling customers to have seamless technological experiences with high-value deliverables. In addtion, I am a guitarist of 35yrs that has grown bands from nothing to sharing stages with national touring artists, as well as starting and running my own guitar amplifier company since 2005. I should also mention I like coffee.

Country Music Television (CMT) / Viacom, Inc.

Software Engineer - Multiplatform
8/2010 - 11/2017

I was a Front End Developer/Engineer for 7yrs+ at Viacom, specifically developing and supporting pages on CMT.com and any sub-pages including major tentpole iniatives. Some recent tech used was HTMl, HTML5, CSS, SASS, LESS, Node, RequireJS, OpenGraph, Javascript, JQuery, Facebook API, CMS, Wordpress, Grails, Vagrant, Bamboo, Git, Subversion (SVN), Tortoise, JIRA, Confluence, all within an Agile environment.

The mikeroweWORKS Foundation

SEO Strategist (volunteer)
4/2017 - 7/2017

In addition to my responsibilites with CMT/Viacom, I volunteered my Search Engine Optimization (SEO) knowledge and strategies to help the mikeroweWORKS Foundation during Q2 of 2017. I collaborated with their team, gathered data requirements and goals, analyzed their environment, and then devised and delivered a proposal, with implementation strategy, to aid them in being more visible within social networks, web searches, and pertinent arenas, facilitating the brand and skilled-worker scholarship awareness on www.profoundlydisconnected.com.

Blue Cross of NEPA

Web Developer II
9/2007 - 5/2010

At Blue Cross, I developed internal applications and external web applications, remaining HIPAA-compliant, developing in a VB .NET environment, with a full stack of HTML, CSS, VB, ODBC, and SQL.

Altria Group, Inc.

Sr. Systems Analyst
6/2004 - 9/2007

Continuing my tenure within the Nabisco/Kraft/Altria Group, I maintained a Wintel environment of 1800+ servers, with ~35% located within VMWare environments, monitoring utilization, performing hotfixes/patching, BIOS updates, and scheduled maintenance.

Nabisco / Kraft Foods, Inc.

PDP and EDI Systems Analyst
5/1999 - 6/2004

My start in IT at Nabsico; I scripted in Korn, Perl, monitored server events with Tivoli Framework. Then, transferred into the Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) department, working within AS400/COBOL, and AS1, AS2 system conversions.

Bullhead Amplification, Inc.

Owner/Master Builder
4/2005 - Current

After understanding that I needed to replace a guitar amp I sold, I figured that I'd learn how to build one to do so. Straight down the rabbit hole of schematics and gather as much info and knowledge as I could, the first amplifier worked rather well and it kickstarted something to grow. Due to the (at the time) small demand to build custom guitar amplifiers for customers. I have now gone on to be featured in major guitar publications for my work, as well as garnering various album credits for national artists' usage of my products.
